sub_topic: Applying the Fourier transform to finance and economics
message_1: Suppose that the daily closing price of a stock over the last 30 days is given by the function f(t) = 2sin(2πt/10) + 3sin(2πt/15), where t is the number of days from today. Find the frequencies and amplitudes of the two sine waves that compose the function using the Fourier transform.
message_2:
In this problem, we are given a function f(t) that is already composed of two sine waves. The Fourier transform is not necessary to find the frequencies and amplitudes of these sine waves, as they are directly given in the function.

The function is:

f(t) = 2sin(2πt/10) + 3sin(2πt/15)

The first sine wave has an amplitude of 2 and a frequency of (2π/10) = π/5. This means it completes one full cycle every 10 days.

The second sine wave has an amplitude of 3 and a frequency of (2π/15) = 2π/15. This means it completes one full cycle every 15 days.

So, the frequencies and amplitudes of the two sine waves are:

1st sine wave: Amplitude = 2, Frequency = π/5
2nd sine wave: Amplitude = 3, Frequency = 2π/15
